data.event: The county was created in 1835 as a municipality of Mexico and organized as a county in 1837.
The county was created in 1835 as a municipality of Mexico and organized as a county in 1837.

Reflecting the county's history as a destination of mid-19th-century German immigrants who came after the 1848 [German] revolutions, in the 2000 US Census more than one-third of residents identified as being of German ancestry.

event.title: 2000 US Census more than one-third of residents identified

data.event: Reflecting the county's history as a destination of mid-19th-century German immigrants who came after the 1848 [German] revolutions, in the 2000 US Census more than one-third of residents identified as being of German ancestry.

(See Demographics below.) In 2013, the syndicated television series, Texas Country Reporter, hosted by Bob Phillips, declared the highways between Brenham and Chappel Hill as the No. 2 site for the viewing of wildflowers within Texas.
